title.narrative: ACCCRN: Asian Cities Climate Resilience Network Phase IV - National Engagement

description.narrative: Program to support the scaling up of urban climate change resilience (UCCR) in Indonesia through engagement with national policy, development of guidelines and development of a national platform for learning and exchange, refinement of tools, and through outreach to new cities to strengthen the capacity of city-level stakeholders to develop city resilience strategies, as part of the Asian Cities Climate Change Resilience Network (ACCCRN).

The goal of Phase IV is institutionalizing UCCR within the Government of Indonesia (GoI), including the incorporation of resilience-building strategies in planning and budgeting processes across all sectors and levels of government.
There are four main objectives: 1. Build an active national level platform consisting of government agencies, non-government organizations, research institutions, private sector and media to monitor, advocate and provide opportunities for learning and sharing information, plus build capacity to support institutionalization of UCCR in Indonesia. 2. Provide knowledge, toolkits and methodologies for the national government to prepare, integrate, and implement UCCR strategy at the national and local level. 3. Work with ACCCRN Phase II and additional “early adopter” cities to integrate ACCCRN methodologies, build resilience, and provide evidence to add momentum for empowering the national mainstreaming of UCCR. 4. Advocate for funding allocation and mechanism for climate change adaptation actions and/or programming within the national government of Indonesia that will enable an increase in allocated budget within the existing national budget line.
